Package com.clorem.db

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clorem.db.Database
  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the helper class for Clorem database. You can perform CRUD operation using this class. This class is similar to that of realtime database. In other words, this database is local as well as online implementation of firebase database. In CloremDB, data is stored as a JSON tree. If you know JSON its good, if not then refer this as the filesystem starting with root directory. You can only access files which are in same directory in witch you are, Similarly, here you can only add,update or remove child which are in your current node. See {@link http://google.com} for more information

      • node

        public Database node​(java.lang.String name)
        Enters the node present in the current node.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the node.
        Returns:
        The same database instance with the new node.
        Throws:
        CloremDatabaseException - if node was not found in the current node.

        public Database newNode​(java.lang.String name)

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new node.
        Returns:
        The same database instance with the newly created node.

        public <T> java.util.ArrayList<T> getChildrenValues​(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Get the values of all the children present in current node
        Parameters:
        type - The type in which you want to retrieve values.
        Returns:
        The list of the values.
        Throws:
        CloremDatabaseException - if key does not holds the the list of type provided.

      • getChildren

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getChildren()
        Get the keys of all the children present in current node
        Returns:
        The list of the keys.

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Commit the changes to the database. This method will erase everything from the memory after writing it to database. Also, the database will be started from root node.This should be the last call of this class as this method calls garbage collector to free up memory. This method's runs synchronously.

      • root

        public Database root()
        Goes to the root node of database.
        Returns:
        The same database instance after moving to root.

      • back

        public Database back()
        Goes one node back from the current node in the database.
        Returns:
        The same database instance after moving back.

      • query

        public Query query()
        Use this to run queries on your database. All queries should be run from the grandparent node of the child you want to query. Grandparent means the parent of the parent node of this child.
        Returns:
        Query object to run queries.
